title: Peach Cobbler
ingredients: ½ cup light brown sugar, packed
4 cups peeled fresh peaches cut into slices
instructions: In a mixing bowl combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and the salt.  Cut in the 4 tablespoons of cold butter with a pastry blender until the mixture is crumbly.  Stir in the milk into the beaten egg and add this mixture to the prepared flour; use only 8 to 10 strokes to blend.  Do not over mix the batter and set it aside.

In a small saucepan combine the brown sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, lemon juice, 2 tablespoons of butter, and a cup of water.  Stir and cook this mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.  When the mixture thickens stir in the sliced peaches and continue cooking for approximately 5 more minutes.
Pour the peaches into an 8-inch baking or casserole dish and spoon the flour mixture over the top; making 6 or 7 large dollops of dough on top of the peaches.
Place in the center rack of the preheated oven and bake for 25 to 30 minutes.
The cobbler is best when served hot with whipped or ice cream.
